trans-unit.source: Step 5(b): Create LOB Relay and LOB Targets for the Insert Operation
trans-unit.target: Step 5(b): Create LOB Relay and LOB Targets for the Insert Operation

trans-unit.source: There are two main steps for exposing an SQL Server table operation as an operation that can be invoked by sending a message over <token>sb2</token> – create an <token>lobtarget</token> and an <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: There are two main steps for exposing an SQL Server table operation as an operation that can be invoked by sending a message over <token>sb2</token> – create an <token>lobtarget</token> and an <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: An <token>lobtarget</token> defines how an Azure application communicates to the Line-of-Business (LOB) system.
trans-unit.target: An <token>lobtarget</token> defines how an Azure application communicates to the Line-of-Business (LOB) system.

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobtarget</token> controls the LOB system connection URI, the operation to perform, and the connection credentials.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobtarget</token> controls the LOB system connection URI, the operation to perform, and the connection credentials.

trans-unit.source: An <token>lobrelay</token> is a WCF service that runs within an organizations firewall and listens to a relay endpoint on the <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: An <token>lobrelay</token> is a WCF service that runs within an organizations firewall and listens to a relay endpoint on the <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: As the name suggests, the <token>lobrelay</token> acts as a relay between the <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint and the LOB system.
trans-unit.target: As the name suggests, the <token>lobrelay</token> acts as a relay between the <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint and the LOB system.

trans-unit.source: It receives the message at the <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint and passes it on to the relevant LOB application by using the <token>lobtarget</token> configuration.
trans-unit.target: It receives the message at the <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint and passes it on to the relevant LOB application by using the <token>lobtarget</token> configuration.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>BizTalk Adapter Service Architecture</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=241590</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>BizTalk Adapter Service Architecture</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=241590</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how to create an <token>lobtarget</token> and an <token>lobrelay</token> to expose the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table in the SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how to create an <token>lobtarget</token> and an <token>lobrelay</token> to expose the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel> table in the SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: To create an SQL Server <token>lobtarget</token>
trans-unit.target: To create an SQL Server <token>lobtarget</token>

trans-unit.source: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, open <legacyBold>Server Explorer</legacyBold>, right-click <embeddedLabel><token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>, and then select <legacyBold>Add Server</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, open <legacyBold>Server Explorer</legacyBold>, right-click <embeddedLabel><token>lobconnect</token></embeddedLabel>, and then select <legacyBold>Add Server</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box that pops up, enter the <token>lobconnect</token> Management URL.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box that pops up, enter the <token>lobconnect</token> Management URL.

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobconnect</token> Management URL is path to the ManagementService.svc WCF service hosted in IIS.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobconnect</token> Management URL is path to the ManagementService.svc WCF service hosted in IIS.

trans-unit.source: This management service monitors the <token>sb2</token> relay service hosted on <token>azure_1</token>.
trans-unit.target: This management service monitors the <token>sb2</token> relay service hosted on <token>azure_1</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> provides more information on the <token>lobconnect</token> components within IIS.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> provides more information on the <token>lobconnect</token> components within IIS.

trans-unit.source: Because you have all the components – <token>af_integration</token> as well as <token>lobconnect</token>, installed on the same computer, the URL for that service will be <codeInline>http://localhost:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Because you have all the components – <token>af_integration</token> as well as <token>lobconnect</token>, installed on the same computer, the URL for that service will be <codeInline>http://localhost:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: If you had installed <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime component on a separate computer, you would have replaced ‘localhost’ in the above URL with the name of that computer.
trans-unit.target: If you had installed <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime component on a separate computer, you would have replaced ‘localhost’ in the above URL with the name of that computer.

trans-unit.source: Click <legacyBold>OK</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Click <legacyBold>OK</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Expand the newly added server, expand <embeddedLabel>LOB Types</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>SQL</embeddedLabel>, and select <embeddedLabel>Add SQL Target</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Expand the newly added server, expand <embeddedLabel>LOB Types</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>SQL</embeddedLabel>, and select <embeddedLabel>Add SQL Target</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard starts.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard starts.

trans-unit.source: Read the information on the <embeddedLabel>Before You Begin</embeddedLabel> page, and then click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Read the information on the <embeddedLabel>Before You Begin</embeddedLabel> page, and then click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Connection Parameters</embeddedLabel> page, enter the details for the SQL Server to connect to and the credentials to use for the connection.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Connection Parameters</embeddedLabel> page, enter the details for the SQL Server to connect to and the credentials to use for the connection.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel> button to build the SQL Server connection URI and also enter the binding properties for the connection.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel> button to build the SQL Server connection URI and also enter the binding properties for the connection.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>The SQL Server Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228970</linkUri></externalLink> provides additional information about how to build the URI.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>The SQL Server Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228970</linkUri></externalLink> provides additional information about how to build the URI.

trans-unit.source: For information about binding properties, see <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for SQL Server Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228971</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about binding properties, see <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for SQL Server Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228971</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, leave the default setting as-is for the binding properties.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, leave the default setting as-is for the binding properties.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> page, from the left box, expand <embeddedLabel>Tables</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel>, and then click the RIGHT ARROW.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel> page, from the left box, expand <embeddedLabel>Tables</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>Claims</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel>, and then click the RIGHT ARROW.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation is listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected operations</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation is listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected operations</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> page, enter the security type.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> page, enter the security type.

trans-unit.source: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: Fixed Username
trans-unit.target: Fixed Username

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you are using a username and password created locally on the LOB system.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you are using a username and password created locally on the LOB system.

trans-unit.source: Fixed Windows credential
trans-unit.target: Fixed Windows credential

trans-unit.source: Select this option to use a Windows domain account.
trans-unit.target: Select this option to use a Windows domain account.

trans-unit.source: Custom SOAP Header
trans-unit.target: Custom SOAP Header

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you create a custom SOAP header to include the username and password.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you create a custom SOAP header to include the username and password.

trans-unit.source: Message Credential
trans-unit.target: Message Credential

trans-unit.source: Select this option if you are including the logon credentials in the WS-Security header of the message.
trans-unit.target: Select this option if you are including the logon credentials in the WS-Security header of the message.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial use the <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows credential</embeddedLabel> option, enter the credentials, and then click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial use the <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows credential</embeddedLabel> option, enter the credentials, and then click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Deployment</embeddedLabel> page, choose an existing <token>lobrelay</token> or create a new <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Deployment</embeddedLabel> page, choose an existing <token>lobrelay</token> or create a new <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: A single <token>lobrelay</token> can be used with multiple <token>lobtarget</token>s.
trans-unit.target: A single <token>lobrelay</token> can be used with multiple <token>lobtarget</token>s.

trans-unit.source: There are some restrictions based on the security model.
trans-unit.target: There are some restrictions based on the security model.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, group the same security method in one <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, group the same security method in one <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: For example, use the same <token>lobrelay</token> to host the <token>lobtarget</token>s that use Message Credential or Fixed Windows security type.
trans-unit.target: For example, use the same <token>lobrelay</token> to host the <token>lobtarget</token>s that use Message Credential or Fixed Windows security type.

trans-unit.source: To create a new <token>lobrelay</token>, enter the following details:
trans-unit.target: To create a new <token>lobrelay</token>, enter the following details:

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: Enter the <token>sb2</token> namespace on which the LOB relay endpoint is created.
trans-unit.target: Enter the <token>sb2</token> namespace on which the LOB relay endpoint is created.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name

trans-unit.source: Enter the issuer name for the <token>sb2</token> namespace
trans-unit.target: Enter the issuer name for the <token>sb2</token> namespace

trans-unit.source: Issuer Secret
trans-unit.target: Issuer Secret

trans-unit.source: Enter the issuer secret for the <token>sb2</token> namespace
trans-unit.target: Enter the issuer secret for the <token>sb2</token> namespace

trans-unit.source: Relay Path
trans-unit.target: Relay Path

trans-unit.source: Enter a name for the relay.
trans-unit.target: Enter a name for the relay.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>SQLLOBRelay</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>SQLLOBRelay</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Target Sub-path
trans-unit.target: Target Sub-path

trans-unit.source: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.
trans-unit.target: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>Claims</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, enter <userInput>Claims</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Target runtime URL
trans-unit.target: Target runtime URL

trans-unit.source: This read-only property displays the URL where the relay is deployed on <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This read-only property displays the URL where the relay is deployed on <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: This is the path where you could send a message to be inserted into the on-premises SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: This is the path where you could send a message to be inserted into the on-premises SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: In our scenario, this is where the <token>bridge</token> routes the message.
trans-unit.target: In our scenario, this is where the <token>bridge</token> routes the message.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel> page, review the values you specified in the previous steps, and then click <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel> page, review the values you specified in the previous steps, and then click <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When the wizard completes, click <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: When the wizard completes, click <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following activities occur in the background:
trans-unit.target: The following activities occur in the background:

trans-unit.source: An <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: An <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.
trans-unit.target: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.

trans-unit.source: Its configuration can also be exported.
trans-unit.target: Its configuration can also be exported.

trans-unit.source: An <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.
trans-unit.target: An <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.

trans-unit.source: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the project.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the project.

trans-unit.source: To use the LOB Target
trans-unit.target: To use the LOB Target

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> and verify that the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property is updated to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> and verify that the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property is updated to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.

trans-unit.source: This is the name that you provided in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> while provisioning the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the name that you provided in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> while provisioning the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Set the security property for the relay endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Set the security property for the relay endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <token>lobtarget</token> in Server Explorer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <token>lobtarget</token> in Server Explorer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties grid, click the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties grid, click the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> against the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows Credentials</embeddedLabel> and enter the username and password to connect to the SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows Credentials</embeddedLabel> and enter the username and password to connect to the SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design surface.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design surface.

trans-unit.source: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: If using the examples above, it will be <legacyItalic><legacyItalic>sqllobrelay_claims</legacyItalic></legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: If using the examples above, it will be <legacyItalic><legacyItalic>sqllobrelay_claims</legacyItalic></legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Open the .config file for the <token>lobtarget</token>, which typically has the naming convention as <legacyItalic>YourRelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: Open the .config file for the <token>lobtarget</token>, which typically has the naming convention as <legacyItalic>YourRelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown below:
trans-unit.target: Enter the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown below:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the config file.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the config file.
